009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ICC_ColorSpace;
012
013import imagingbook.common.color.cie.NamedIccProfile;
014import imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * This color space class is based on the "AdobeRGB1998.icc" profile. It only
021 * serves as an example for creating color spaces from ICC profiles.
022 * See Sec. 14.5 of [1] for details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
026 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2022/11/13
031 */
032@SuppressWarnings("serial")
033public class AdobeRgbColorSpace extends ICC_ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion, RgbReferenceData {
034
035        private static AdobeRgbColorSpace instance = null;
036        
037        private AdobeRgbColorSpace() {
038                super(NamedIccProfile.AdobeRGB1998.getProfile());       // constructor of ICC_ColorSpace
039        }
040
041        /**
042         * Returns an instance of {@link AdobeRgbColorSpace}.
043         * @return an instance of {@link AdobeRgbColorSpace}
044         */
045        public static AdobeRgbColorSpace getInstance() {
046                if (instance == null) {
047                        instance = new AdobeRgbColorSpace();
048                }
049                return instance;
050        }
051        
052        // Taken from Adobe RGB (1998) Color Image Encoding (Version 2005-05)
053        private static final double[][] Mrgbi = 
054                {{0.57667, 0.18556, 0.18823},
055                 {0.29734, 0.62736, 0.07529},
056                 {0.02703, 0.07069, 0.99134}};
057        
058        @Override
059        public float[] getWhitePoint() {
060                // (0.9505, 1.0000, 1.0891) 
061                return Matrix.toFloat(StandardIlluminant.D65.getXYZ());
062        }
063        
064        @Override
065        public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
066                return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
067        }
068
069}
